intro: Antidesma kusaiense, commonly known as the African star fruit or Kusai bush, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are often consumed locally. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
